segments.text: The kitchen is such a mess with water everywhere, and no one seems to care.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is just drying dishes like nothing is wrong.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The children are being so mischievous, and she's completely unaware.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can't believe how much water is on the floor, it's dangerous.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy on the stool is about to fall, and the girl is just waiting for cookies.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel frustrated that no one is doing anything about the water or the kids.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The scene outside the window is so peaceful, unlike the chaos inside.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder how long it will take for someone to notice the overflowing sink.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The whole situation is just so careless and messy.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope someone cleans up soon before someone gets hurt.
segments.speaker: PAR
